title: aoppo
author: aoppo
created_time: May 09, 2023, 03:20:33 PMLast edit: May 11, 2023, 02:40:17 PM by aoppo
content: Hello, I just finished my three-year degree in History, discussing the following thesis: Blockchain: decentralization of currency, power and the state.The idea that prompted me to choose this topic was to analyze the blockchain phenomenon from a historical or social science perspective, trying to complicate what we already know and trying to make this subject simple for those who are not technicians.I am not sure if I have succeeded, but it is definitely a start, and those who start are halfway there. Now I would like to gather feedbacks and then publish it as an e-book.If you would like to read it and let me know what you think, you can write to me publicly or privately.As I said, I would like to keep updating it (or rewriting it) and then make it an e-book. Any advice is appreciated!Direct download: https://cloud.9minuti.it/s/6HEn2HFja6k4PMYLink to my blog post https://alexoppo.com/ending-my-history-bachelor-with-a-thesis-about-blockchainsThis discussion is a translation of this thread. https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5451100.0The thesis was translated with DeepL, so probably there are still errors.

comments.author: Road21Bitcoin
comments.body: Wow, this is really impressive and must have taken up so much time and research on your part. I have downloaded and started reading it and found your introduction really interesting. Now that I think about it, the blockchain is the natural evolution of all the technological evolutions the world has gone through. If I am understanding it right, the blockchain presents a new way of looking at history and how it will be perceived and understood in the future.I will try to finish this and give my thoughts.

comments.author: Lorence.xD
comments.body: This is actually good, I remembered when I was in senior high school my friend suggested me to use cryptocurrency effectiveness into the economic situation as our research. I thought our professor would think of it as a joke but he'd agreed to our research title as long as we could provide informations for it. And we'd defended it since we have knowledge about crypto and it might help students to learn from it.
